argumentText:
ARGUMENT
x

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | #P_elsn | |- ( x e. { A } <-> x = A ) |
| 2 |  | #P_eleq1a | |- ( A e. B -> ( x = A -> x e. B ) ) |
| 3 | 1, 2 | #P_syl5bi | |- ( A e. B -> ( x e. { A } -> x e. B ) ) |
| 4 | 3 | #P_alrimiv | |- ( A e. B -> A. x ( x e. { A } -> x e. B ) ) |
| 5 |  | #P_dfss2 | |- ( { A } C_ B <-> A. x ( x e. { A } -> x e. B ) ) |
| 6 | 4, 5 | #P_sylibr | |- ( A e. B -> { A } C_ B ) |
\
 If a class is an element of another class, then its singleton is a subclass of that other class.  Alternate proof of ~ snssi .  This theorem was automatically generated from ~ snssiALTVD using a translation program.  (Contributed by Alan Sare, 11-Sep-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
